data.title: Watch: Lokesh Kanagaraj, Anirudh mobbed as they enter theatre to watch 'Leo'
meta_keywords: Lokesh Kanagaraj and Anirudh Ravichander  mobbed
data.meta_description: Thalapathy Vijayâ€™s film 'Leo' released in theatres today, October 19. Director Lokesh Kanagaraj and Anirudh Ravichander were mobbed by fans at Chrompet Vettri theatre in Chennai as they went to watch the film.
data.text:
The release of 'Leo' has been nothing short of a celebration for fans across the country! The excitement for Thalapathy Vijay's film is at its peak as fans went for early morning shows and danced in theatres. The film is also getting an overwhelming response from the audience. While many feel it is a blockbuster, others can't stop praising Vijay's performance. Amid the craze, 'Leo' director Lokesh Kanagaraj and composer Anirudh Ravichander arrived at a Chennai theatre to watch the film. However, they were mobbed.

advertisement

LOKESH, ANIRUDH MOBBED OUTSIDE CHENNAI THEATRE

Several visuals from cinema halls show how the fan frenzy for 'Leo' is at an all-time high. The audience danced in theatres, cheered and hooted, and also burst crackers.

Director Lokesh Kanagaraj and composer Anirudh Ravichander arrived at Chrompet Vettri theatre in Chennai to watch the film. However, they were quickly mobbed as fans surrounded. Even then, the duo smiled.

Watch it below:

ABOUT 'LEO'

'Leo' is an action thriller written and directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj. The film's screenplay is co-written by Rathna Kumar and Deeraj Vaidy. The film has been making headlines ever since it was announced.

It boasts an ensemble cast including Sanjay Dutt, Trisha, Arjun Sarja, Mysskin, Gautham Vasudev Menon, Mansoor Ali Khan, Priya Anand and Sandy in important roles. Produced by Seven Screen Studios, 'Leo' has music scored by Anirudh Ravichander.
